Week 3: Community Connections

Social Support Tile: Local Programs and Services
- Description: Videos and information about social support programs, medication reminders, and local community services that can help patients and families manage COPD.
- Benefit: Encourages participation in local programs and services, leading to improved health outcomes and social connections.
Family Feedback Tile: Input and Improvement
- Description: A tile that collects patient and family feedback on the quality of care and content received, helping care teams better understand community needs.
- Benefit: Enables care teams to develop more effective community programs and adjust the care plan based on patient and family feedback.
Quality Check-In Tile: Progress Review
- Description: A tile that assesses patients' and families' satisfaction with care quality, progress with social support programs, and medication compliance.
- Benefit: Provides valuable insights for care managers to make necessary adjustments and improvements to the care plan.
Coaching Call 3: Community Connections Review
- Description: Care manager reviews the patient's progress, including participation in social support programs and medication compliance, and discusses local support group participation. The care manager also listens to the patient's thoughts and asks forward-looking questions.
- Benefit: Reinforces patient progress and encourages community connections, fostering a more supportive care experience.
Testimonial Tile: Support Group Success Stories
- Description: Post-call video with patient testimonials sharing the benefits of joining support groups and engaging in community programs.
- Benefit: Inspires patients to become more involved in social programs and expand their support networks.

Week 4: Responsibility

Testimonial Tile 2: Success Stories and Responsibility
- Description: Videos featuring testimonials from successful patients, highlighting the importance of taking responsibility for their care and management of COPD.
- Benefit: Inspires patients to take an active role in managing their health and to learn from others' experiences.
Community Services Tile: Additional Support Options
- Description: An introduction to additional community services that can further support patients and families in managing COPD.
- Benefit: Expands patients' knowledge of available resources and encourages them to seek additional support when needed.
Assessment Tile 4: Future Commitments
- Description: Videos and questions asking patients and families about their willingness to continue their progress and commitment to COPD management.
- Benefit: Ensures patients are motivated and committed to maintaining their health improvements in the long term.
Discharge Education Improvement Tile: Feedback and Recommendations
- Description: A tile asking patients and families to share their thoughts on the care they received, including what they liked, what could be improved, and additional resources they would recommend.
- Benefit: Provides valuable insights for care teams to improve future care plans and incorporate patients' suggestions.
Coaching Call 4: Taking Control of Health
- Description: Care manager utilizes the coaching tool to show images of patients taking control of their health, inspiring and empowering the patient. The care manager then asks questions to support the patient in taking a more active role in managing their COPD.
- Benefit: Helps patients feel more confident and empowered to take responsibility for their care and health outcomes.

- Benefit: Ensures patients and families have access to relevant resources and adjusts the care plan based on their feedback.

Check-in Tile: Medication Review
- Description: A video-based check-in tile that reviews inhaler usage, medication benefits, and collects information on the patient's breathing abilities, vitals, medications, and community resources.
- Benefit: Reinforces the importance of medication compliance and helps track the patient's progress.
Coaching Call: Orientation Review
- Care manager reviews the patient's progress, compliance, and comfort based on their interactions with the tiles and addresses any concerns or questions.
- Benefit: Fosters a supportive relationship between the patient and care manager, ensuring the patient feels heard and understood.
Encouragement Tile: Post-Call Follow-Up
- Description: A follow-up note with positive reinforcement and patient testimonials of success.
- Benefit: Motivates patients by showcasing positive outcomes and fosters a sense of accomplishment.
